author: Ceylon Today
title: Rise in Cybercrime: Causes, Challenges and Solutions
text:
By Ayeshma Wanninayake
There has been a noticeable rise in complaints concerning internet-related crimes, including financial fraud, with a significant involvement of foreign nationals in such activities. This discussion features insights from Dr. Mangala Keerthi de Pasqual, Senior Lecturer at the Department of Mass Communication, University of Kelaniya, focusing on the underlying causes of the increase in cybercrime and the strategies needed to mitigate these offences.
Why Cybercrime is on the Rise
Cybercrime encompasses activities such as fraudulent financial transactions, online insults, hate speech, and various forms of deception. One significant factor contributing to the rise in cybercrime in Sri Lanka is the increasing use of the internet. Approximately 12.2 million people, representing 56% of the countryâ€™s population, access the internet, with nearly 8 million of them active on social media. While this expanding digital landscape offers numerous benefits, it also brings with it significant risks.
A significant contributor to the growth of cybercrime in Sri Lanka is the low level of digital literacy among internet users. Many people, especially middle-aged individuals, lack awareness of safe online practices, making them susceptible to scams. The misuse of one-time passwords (OTPs) and a lack of knowledge about mobile applications often lead to financial losses.
Cybercriminals have also exploited the internet to facilitate drug trafficking, arms smuggling, and money laundering. Personal security concerns are rising, particularly for women and children, with cases of explicit images being shared or manipulated and personal photos being misused online.
While institutions like the National Institute of Education are working to incorporate digital literacy into school curricula, the current lack of awareness has created an environment where cybercrime can thrive.
Global Measures to Combat Cybercrime
Countries like the United States and Australia have made significant strides in combatting cybercrime. In the U.S., organisations such as the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) have established dedicated units to address these issues. The European Union also enforces stringent laws and promotes awareness campaigns to tackle online crimes such as money laundering.
China has implemented a comprehensive approach by developing its own social media platforms and maintaining a self-contained digital ecosystem. Strict cybersecurity laws and severe penalties have helped minimise cybercrimes, particularly those targetting women and children.
In contrast, many Asian and African countries, including Sri Lanka, lag in addressing these challenges. Reports of Sri Lankans being exploited in cybercrime camps abroad highlight the need for more robust local interventions.
Sri Lankaâ€™s Legal and Institutional Framework
Recent reports of foreign nationals perpetrating financial fraud in Sri Lanka have drawn attention to the countryâ€™s legal framework. Over the past few weeks, nearly 100 individuals, including Chinese nationals, have been arrested for organising financial cybercrimes.
Data from the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (CERT) indicates that 232 complaints were reported in September alone. Middle-aged individuals are particularly vulnerable, as they are more likely to fall for pyramid schemes or fraudulent offers due to poor digital literacy.
The Government has taken steps to address these issues by establishing a cyber-surveillance unit under the National Child Protection Authority and creating an â€œInternet Complaints Divisionâ€ for reporting cybercrimes. The recent Online Safety Bill Act aims to strengthen the legal framework for combatting cybercrime.
However, alongside legal reforms, there is an urgent need to educate the public about safe internet practices, such as protecting confidential information and recognising fake accounts.
Social Media and Cybercrime
Social media has become a double-edged sword. While it facilitates communication and connectivity, its lack of regulation enables anonymity, making it a fertile ground for fraud and other crimes. Fake accounts are frequently used for financial scams and the distribution of obscene content.
Victims often include middle-aged individuals, as well as women and children, who are exposed to risks such as photo manipulation, harassment, and hate speech. In some cases, intimate photos are leaked online, causing significant harm to the victims.
The rise of social media usage, especially among digital natives born after 2000, underscores the need for proactive measures. While keeping youth and children away from digital platforms is impractical, greater regulation and education are critical to reducing the risks associated with social media.
Vulnerable Groups
Research indicates that middle-aged individuals, particularly those aged 40 to 65, are most susceptible to financial fraud. Data from CERT and international studies show that women and children are also at high risk of exploitation and harassment online.
A recent BBC report highlighted the prevalence of photo manipulation and explicit content sharing, particularly targetting young women. This underscores the need for targetted interventions to protect vulnerable groups.
Building Public Awareness
Raising public awareness is critical to reducing cybercrime and its harmful impacts. Educating people about safe internet practices and the risks associated with online activities can significantly decrease vulnerabilities. Integrating digital literacy into school curricula, higher education, and public programmes is essential to help individuals navigate the digital world securely. Institutions like the Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (CERT) and the Police play vital roles in this effort, teaching people how to recognise fake accounts, protect confidential information, and avoid risky behaviours such as sharing one-time passwords (OTPs). Outreach programmes in rural areas, facilitated by local Police and community centres such as temples, can further strengthen awareness efforts. The media also plays a key role in disseminating information through articles, television programmes, and campaigns. Additionally, the National Child Protection Authority has established a WhatsApp No. 077320033, allowing the public to report crimes involving children and other cyber-related incidents. While tools and resources exist, increasing public knowledge of these services and fostering a culture of digital responsibility are essential steps in building a digitally safe and aware society.
The Role of Legal Enforcement
The enforcement of laws to prevent cybercrime and internet-related offences is essential and must be consistent. The newly -introduced Online Safety Bill includes provisions aimed at addressing such issues. If media freedom is compromised through cyberspace, it is crucial to strengthen laws via legislative action. Cybercrime, internet fraud, and online offences should be effectively tackled through the introduction of new laws and the imposition of stricter penalties. Many countries have successfully curbed these issues by implementing stringent punishments. These crimes can be prevented by combining legal reforms with ongoing efforts to improve digital literacy. Such measures will help reduce risks to children and women, safeguarding them from exploitation and protecting their finances from fraud.
About the Author:
Ayeshma Wanninayake, Communications and Media Unit, University of Kelaniya

title: Tech Layoffs in 2024: KPMG, Intel, Dell, Luminar and Others Reduce Hundreds of Employees This Year, So Far
text:
Tech Layoffs in 2024: KPMG, Intel, Dell, Luminar and Others Reduce Hundreds of Employees This Year, So Far 1.49 Lakh People Affected Tech Layoffs in 2024: KPMG, Intel, Dell, Luminar, and others have laid off hundreds of employees, with 1.49 lakh people affected so far. Technology Team Latestly | Dec 01, 2024 12:52 PM IST A+ A- Layoffs, Fired, Job Cuts Representational Image (Photo Credits: Pexels) Mumbai, December 1: In 2024, tech layoffs were significant as they impacted lives of thousands of employees. The year has been challenging for some employees and companies in the technology sector. The companies like Intel, Dell, Cisco, IBM and others have announced layoffs of thousands of employees for various reasons.
So far, the tech industry has lost 1,49,006, according to data offered by Layoffs. Fyi, a job cuts tracking website. The website listed 519 companies that reduced their workforce. KPMG layoffs were announced this year, affecting 330 positions from the US audit team. It reduced 4% of the workforce from the company with 9,000 audit employees. KPMG Layoffs: British Multinational Accounting Firm To Lay Off 4% of Its US Workforce To Align Workforceâ€™s Size, Shape and Skills With Market Needs.
Intel and Dell announced they would cut over 15,000 and 12,500 people, respectively. Luminar, a significant supplier of LiDAR and automotive tech-related products, announced layoffs of its 30% workforce. Computer software company Oracle announced the layoffs of hundreds of people. Schaeffler, an automotive company from Germany, announced laying off around 4,700 employees across Europe amid witnessing a 50% decline in operating profit.
Freshworks and Bosch, another two companies, also laid off hundreds of workers this year. Freshworks layoffs affected 13% employees from its workforce. Bosch layoffs, announced last month, were set to affect nearly 7,000 employees from the global workforce. KPMG laid off around 4% of the workforce to align with market needs. Besides, Samsung, Mozilla, X, Qualcomm and X also reduced significant workforce.
Nissan cut 1,000 jobs, and Ford announced that it would let go of 4,000 jobs. AMD, struggling amid the rise of AI chipsets and other companies, decided to let go of 1,000 people as a part of streamlining operations. Recently, reports suggested that HSBC Holdings, one of the biggest financial companies and banks, asked its employees to re-apply for new roles in separate departments formed by CEO Georges Elhedery; Volkswagen announced layoffs of thousands of people along with offering 10% less salary and shut down three of its plants. Tech Layoffs 2024: Samsung, Mozilla, X, TikTok, Qualcomm and Others Significantly Reduce Their Workforce This Year, Thousands of Employees Lose Jobs.
Overall, this year, the tech layoffs affected several hundreds impacting their lives. The layoffs were triggered by the company's poor financial performance, AI adoption and restructuring efforts. Some of the company failed to compete in the market with rivals and decided to save costs for some other purpose.

title: Prosegur is hiring throughout Brazil: 280 vacancies open with and without experience for Security Guard, Doorman, Driver and General Services Assistant - CPG Click Petroleo e Gas
text:
Prosegur has more than 280 openings throughout Brazil for security guards, doormen, assistants, drivers, and other positions. Opportunities available with and without experience; apply online.
Prosegur, one of the world's largest private security companies, has over 280 openings throughout Brazil, for candidates with and without experience. Opportunities cover a variety of roles, including security guards, doormen, general services assistants, drivers, and other operational and administrative positions. The company is seeking new talent to strengthen its workforce in the areas of property security, cash transportation, facilities, and support services.
As registration is now open and can be done exclusively online, through the company's official platform.
The vacancies are distributed across several regions of the country and offer market-compatible benefits, in addition to real opportunities for internal growth and professional development within a multinational company consolidated in the sector.
Prosegur has vacancies for security guards, doormen, drivers and general services assistants.
The selection process includes candidates with different levels of education and experience, expanding access to people seeking their first job, as well as professionals already working in security, transportation, or general services. The main open positions include:
- Security guard
- Porteiro
- general service assistant
- Armored car driver
- Monitoring center attendant
- Receptionist
- Administrative Assistant
- CCTV Operator
- access controller
- logistics assistant
Opportunities are for different shifts and may vary depending on the Prosegur unit or branch in each state.
Who can apply for Prosegur vacancies?
The company accepts CVs of candidates with and without experience, but requires the professional meet the basic requirements of the position, such as minimum education, driver's license for drivers and, in the case of security guards, it is mandatory to have an up-to-date course and recycling.
Other desirable requirements include:
- Completed elementary or secondary education (depending on the role);
- Time availability;
- Good communication and professional attitude;
- Ability to work in a team and under pressure;
- Commitment and punctuality.
The company values the diversity and inclusion, encouraging the candidacy of women, people with disabilities and professionals over 50 years old.
Benefits offered by Prosegur
Prosegur employees have access to a benefits package that may include:
- Salary compatible with the role and regional minimum wage;
- Transportation vouchers and / or fuel voucher;
- Food allowance or meal;
- Medical and odontologic assistence;
- group life insurance;
- Partnerships with educational institutions and academies;
- Career path and internal training.
These benefits vary according to the unit, position and location, but in general they guarantee a good structure for the worker to perform their duties with safety and stability.
How to apply for Prosegur vacancies
To participate in the selection process, the candidate must access the company's official recruitment page:
ðŸ”— https://prosegur.referrals.selectminds.com/br/page/ver-todos-1323 ðŸ‘ˆ
In the portal, you can:
- Filter jobs by state, city, or role;
- Read the requirements and duties of each position;
- Create a profile and register your CV directly for the desired vacancy;
- Monitor the progress of the selection process.
The platform is constantly updated, and new positions may appear at any time, especially in metropolitan areas or when expanding contracts.
Prosegur offers career path and stability in the security sector
Operating in more than 25 countries, Prosegur is recognized for its professional management model and ongoing training policies. Employees have opportunities for growth within the company itself, which frequently conducts internal promotions e technical requalifications.
The company also invests in technology and training, ensuring that your employees are able to work efficiently in corporate, industrial, residential environments and large-scale events.
Highlights of Prosegur's job selection
- +280 vacancies open throughout Brazil
- Positions with and without previous experience requirements
- Market-competitive salaries and benefits
- Fully online selection process
- First job or relocation opportunity
- Vacancies for security guards, doormen, drivers, assistants and more
Prosegur's openings represent an excellent opportunity for those looking to enter or re-enter the job market, offering stability, benefits, and real opportunities for professional development. If you're looking for a solid company with a national presence and multinational structure, this could be your chance.
Don't miss the deadline: visit the website, register your CV and participate in the selection process!
